alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 6:56AM PST until March 10 at 9:45AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .The Green Valley Creek has risen rapidly overnight. Flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 100 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. The Green Valley Creek has risen rapidly overnight. Flooding is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 AM PST, Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sebastopol, Forestville and Graton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
